helpers.errorhelper¶

Classes¶

ErrorHelper

This class provides standardized error handling and command help messaging for Slack bot interactions.

Module Contents¶

class helpers.errorhelper.ErrorHelper[source]¶

This class provides standardized error handling and command help messaging for Slack bot interactions.

Why: Simplifies error reporting by formatting consistent and informative error messages, which include helpful command usage information to guide users.

How: Common usage examples: 1. ErrorHelper.get_error_payload_blocks(command): Retrieve error blocks with help information for a specific command. 2. ErrorHelper.get_command_help(command): Retrieve a customized error message for a specific command.

error_payload[source]¶
error_block_1[source]¶
command_help[source]¶
get_error_payload_blocks(command)[source]¶

Retrieves error message blocks with help information for a specified command.

Parameters:

command (str) – Command name to provide help for.

Returns:

List of formatted error blocks for Slack display.

Return type:

list[dict[str, Any]]

Why: Combines a generic error message with command-specific help, giving users clarity on how to correct their input. How: Example usage - ` error_blocks = error_helper.get_error_payload_blocks("create") `

get_command_help(command, args=[])[source]¶

Retrieves an error message with usage instructions or details for a specific command.

Parameters:

  • command (str) – Command name for which help or an error message is needed.

  • args (list) – Optional arguments for customizing certain messages.

Returns:

Formatted error or help message for the specified command.

Return type:

str

Why: Provides specific feedback and guidance for users on errors or command usage. How: Example usage - ` help_message = error_helper.get_command_help("task_done") `
